outputs.output_descr:
Main project objectives for the fifth phase in relation to Trinidad and Tobago's compliance with the provisions of the Montreal Protocol are as follows:
1) Implementation of the second and final phase of the Terminal Phase-out management plan for chlorofluorocarbons.
2) Further strengthening of the system used by customs officers in the monitoring and control of Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) and ODS-dependent technologies with the objective of identification of gaps and upgrade of the present system to ensure this country's ability to deter the illegal ODS trade.
3) Increase the institutional capacity of the Ntional Ozone Unit.
4) Increase sector and public awareness to ODS issues.
5) Support and monitor the development and implementation of a mandatory refigerant standard.
6) Increase public awareness with respect to Methyl Bromide and its alternatives.
7) Monitor and support the implementation of policies and legislation for the retail wholesale and use of Methyl Bromide, specifically for quarantine and pre-shipment.
8) Monitor the compliance of the complete phase-out of CFCs in Trinidad and Tobago.
9) Increase general knowledge about the Montreal Protocol and the ozone layer.
10) Report annual data to the Multilateral Fund (MLF) Secretariat and the Ozone Secretariat.

Main project objectives for the sixth phase in relation to Trinidad and Tobago's compliance with the provisions of the Montreal Protocol are as follows:
1) Maintain zero imports of CFCs.
2) Strengthen system used by customs officers in the monitoring and control of ODS and ODS-dependent technologies with the objective of identification of gaps and upgrade of the present system to ensure this country's ability to deter illegal ODS trade.
3) Manage the country's import consumption of HCFC to ensure smooth phase out in HCFC comsumption and continued reduction in the imports of Methyl Bromide.
4) Increase sector and public awareness to ODS issues.
5) Follow-up on  the development and implementation of a mandatory refigerant standard.
6) Increase public awareness with respect to Methyl Bromide and its alternatives.
7) Formulate more stringent policies and legislation for the retail, wholesale, and use of Methyl Bromide, specifically for quarantine and pre-shipment.
8) Monitor the compliance of phase-out.
9) Increase institutional capacity of National Ozone Unit.
10) Update GIS database to include informal mobile air-conditioning, and refrigeration sector including the commercial refrigeration sector.
11) Review of sectoral usage of all ODS.
12) Annual data reporting to the Multilateral Fund (MLF) Secretariat and the Ozone Secretariat.
13) Increase public awareness with respect to HCFCs and its alternatives.
14) Follow-up review of Methyl Bromide usage in Trinidad and Tobago.
15) Assist with the preparation of the HCFC Phase Out Management Plan.

project_descr: Institutional Strengthening to support the National Ozone Office, Environmental Management Authority, and the Government of Trinidad and Tobago for implementation of the Montreal Protocol provisions
project_title: INS MP Phase V and VI
